items.title: As calls grow for a Bondi royal commission, do Albanese's arguments stand up?
items.summary: The prime minister has said an intelligence review is a faster and more appropriate tool to get answers on the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: The opposition leader in exile who once ran against Europe's longest-reigning autocrat
items.summary: Meet the woman sentenced to 15 years in prison in her home country who Australian leaders call "a fearless advocate for democracy and justice".

items.title: Where Australian luxury travellers are heading in 2026 — and what it could cost
items.summary: As many Aussies tighten their purse strings, here's what budget-conscious travellers can expect before hitting these predicted travel hotspots.

items.title: Searches called off for missing swimmers after 'absolutely horrendous' start to 2026
items.summary: The scaling-back of search efforts follows a series of fatal drownings described by the Surf Life Saving NSW CEO as an "absolutely horrendous" start to the year.

items.title: Sparklers pinpointed as cause of Swiss New Year's blaze that killed 40 and injured over 100
items.summary: Investigators say sparklers held under a foam-clad ceiling likely ignited the deadly blaze.

items.title: UN secretary-general calls on Israel to reverse aid organisation ban
items.summary: Israel's new rules for humanitarian organisations have been criticised as arbitrary and harmful to Palestinians in need of aid.

items.title: 'Alarming' spike in magpies paralysed by mystery illness
items.summary: While many options have been ruled out, one expert says researchers are not any closer to identifying the cause of the illness.

items.title: Israeli government said it is 'willing to assist' Australian police in countering terrorism
items.summary: The Israeli government has steeply criticised the Albanese government in a letter to the home affairs minister.

items.title: Power, pirate flags and political upheaval: How youth-led protests spread across borders
items.summary: From Kathmandu to Manila, 2025 became a year when streets pushed back. Youth-led protests challenged corruption, demanding accountability.

items.title: Why Usman Khawaja's influence went far beyond the cricket pitch
items.summary: From advocating for representation to speaking out on Gaza, Usman Khawaja's influence reaches well beyond the boundary — with many Australians viewing him as "a symbol of resilience and inclusion".

items.title: Trump says US will intervene if Iran 'violently kills' protesters after reports of six deaths
items.summary: Protests in Iran that started over high rates of inflation and a fall in the currency have led to several deaths, Iranian media reports say.

items.title: Amid rising military pressure, Venezuela's Maduro says he's open to dialogue with the US
items.summary: The Venezuelan government has neither confirmed nor denied Donald Trump's claim of a US strike on a "dock area where they load the boats up with drugs" in Venezuela.

items.title: Crowd chants 'tax the rich' as Zohran Mamdani sworn in as first Muslim mayor of New York
items.summary: Mamdani, a self-described democratic socialist, comes to power at a time when Trump has pushed a hard-right agenda.

items.title: China reimposes taxes on condoms, contraceptive drugs to spur flagging birth rate
items.summary: China's population fell for a third consecutive year in 2024 and experts have warned the downturn will continue.

items.title: 'I put myself out there': Khawaja calls stumps on international career with message to critics
items.summary: Khawaja said he'll forever carry the memories, friendships and "lessons that shaped me".

items.title: Dakar Rally 2026 nears as Aussie champ Daniel Sanders eyes 'back-to-back' wins
items.summary: The 48th edition of the Dakar Rally kicks off this weekend in Saudi Arabia. Here's what to know about the gruelling motor race.

items.title: The advice this Howard-era immigration minister would give to Sussan Ley
items.summary: Philip Ruddock, the father of Australia's controversial asylum seekers policy, says the Opposition shouldn't fixate on numbers.

items.summary: The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade said it was seeking to confirm the reported death with authorities in Ukraine.

items.title: Albanese rejects human rights commissioner's call for Bondi royal commission
items.summary: The prime minister has continued to resist calls for a royal commission into the Bondi attack after a new voice joined the chorus appealing for one.

items.title: Israeli military kills man in West Bank, UN condemns utilities cut to Palestinian refugee agency
items.summary: The Israeli military killed a man in the occupied West Bank on Thursday. Separately, the UN has criticised Israel's ban on supplying water or electricity to UNRWA facilities.

items.title: 'Weak agreements only fuel the war': Zelenskyy says Ukraine ready for a 'strong peace'
items.summary: "Are we tired? Very. Does ‍this mean we are ready to surrender? Anyone who thinks so is deeply mistaken," Zelenskyy said in his New Year address.

items.title: 'Casualties should be anticipated': Howard warned on sending elite soldiers to Afghanistan
items.summary: Declassified documents reveal what John Howard's cabinet considered, and ignored, when sending troops to Afghanistan.

items.title: A childhood erased: Abducted by her mother and raised as a missing person
items.summary: After being abducted, Rose was forced to spend her childhood living under a false identity and trying to evade police.
